problem.markdown:
>>Which statement is NOT true about Jackson networks?<<
( ) It is relatively easy to compute performance measures and provide intuition. ( ) It is good approximation for a large class of systems. ( ) It is easy to optimize and to use for design. ( X ) It has the ability to deal with systems with storage bottlenecks.
[explanation] When the storage area is full, blocking will happen. Then any station that needs to put parts into that area needs to be idle. This will reduce productivity and efficiency. [explanation]
